scientific_name: Astilbe arendsii 'Beauty of Ernst' COLOR FLASH

hardiness_location.full_iframe: <iframe frameborder=0 scrolling=yes seamless=seamless width=1000 height=550 style='margin:auto;' src='https://perenual.com/api/hardiness-map?species_id=1060&size=og&key=sk-kMpx68b02586bb61112084'></iframe>

description: Astilbe Arendsii 'Beauty of Ernst' COLOR FLASH is an amazing plant species that not only looks stunning with its large, full and brilliantly contrasting pale pink and white flowers, but is also incredibly low maintenance and hardy. The large plumes of blooms stretch up to a height of 75cms and remain vibrant throughout the summer. They thrive in any moist and partially shaded environment, making them great for planting in borders, beside water features and in pots. Their foliage turns a beautiful yellow-orange in the autumn, making them an eye-catching addition to any garden. The COLOR FLASH variety has been especially bred to offer an even more striking contrast in flower colour, making it truly spectacular.
